alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Laurel and southwestern Jackson Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Victory, or 9 miles north of London, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Atlanta and Mcwhorter around 320 PM EDT. East Bernstadt and Hare around 330 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Carmichael, Langnau, London, Maplesville, Pittsburg and Bernstadt. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 41 and 47. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 6 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
